messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] organic
messages.msgSnippet: Bread and Circus carries it too. ... From:  To:  Sent: Saturday, June 03, 2000 12:38 PM Subject: Re:
messages.messageBody:
Bread and Circus carries it too.
----- Original Message -----
From: <Natrlmama@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, June 03, 2000 12:38 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] organic


> In a message dated 06/03/2000 11:37:31 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
> bonniepainter@... writes:
>
> <<
> I also have tried to move to organic for my family, but some things that
we
> love to eat (watermelon for example) we still havent' been able to
find...
> >>
> We purchase organic produce either at farmers markets, through our
> coop or from health food stores like Whole Foods. Mostly from
> coop I get a case of watermelon (my kids can eat one a day!) and
> in June-july whenever the local farmers get their watermelons then I
> buy weekly from them.
> Kathy
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] organic
messages.msgSnippet: LOL!  My kids too!  Thanks for the information.  Do you know how you would go about finding a food co-op?
messages.messageBody:
<<(my kids can eat one a day!)>> LOL! My kids too! Thanks for the
information. Do you know how you would go about finding a food co-op?

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] organic
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 06/03/2000 11:37:31 AM Pacific Daylight Time, bonniepainter@hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 06/03/2000 11:37:31 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
bonniepainter@... writes:

<<
I also have tried to move to organic for my family, but some things that we
love to eat (watermelon for example) we still havent' been able to find...
>>
We purchase organic produce either at farmers markets, through our
coop or from health food stores like Whole Foods. Mostly from
coop I get a case of watermelon (my kids can eat one a day!) and
in June-july whenever the local farmers get their watermelons then I
buy weekly from them.
Kathy
